data.title: Great Place to Stay
data.text: I surprised my Husband and took him out for a night and stayed here and had a great time plus won some money also. And listened to the Band play at Gilleys they where great had a lot of fun.

data.title: I didn't expect much and that's what I got
data.text:
Old and decrepit.

The bathroom was a disgrace.   There was literally no shower head, just a pipe  spewing water into the tub, which desperately needed to be recaulked.  With the water came some filthy black residue that settled on the bottom of the tub like some sort of alien rash.

There was an ironing board  but no iron, which according to housekeeping, should have been in the room, ditto on the clock radio.

In spite of turning the air conditioning to its lowest setting (55), room never got to a reasonable sleeping temperature,.

The non smoking floor reeked of cigarette smoke, probably an occupational hazard in a casino in Nevada.

Almost all of the rooms have an adjoining room leaving you to the mercy of the drunks next door desperately trying to circumvent the knocked door between you at 2 a.m.

Rosie's Diner, on the main casino floor makes you wish for almost any generic restaurant.   We had hash browns that were white, eggs that were prefab something they called a buttermilk doughnut  that had no resemblance to buttermilk or a doughnut, as well as the worst bagel  I have ever experienced.   Safeway you  have nothing to worry about. 

The bed was surprisingly comfortable with  quality linens.  Housekeeping did a fine job.

data.title: A five star rating on a one star budget
data.text:
The Nugget is a casino but it also has wonderful accommodations.  It has several great choices of restaurants.
We found the rooms to be clean and well accommodated.  The rooms were quiet and had all the pleasantries of a five star accommodation.
The restaurants within the Casino gave a person several excellent choices, from the "Steak House" to "Rosita's " they also have full buffets and sea-food, Oriental cuisine and all the food was reasonably priced.
We have stayed there several times and hope to continue to add The Nugget to our homes away from home.

data.title: I expected little but was WOW'd
data.text: I thought this town would be small but it butts right up to Reno and you don't know where it stops or begins. Its all very nice and fabulous views of the mountains.We were given a free buffet since we were with a bus tour and the food was excellent. The casino was a good size and very clean and modern.

data.title: Always a good choice for groups/conventions, etc.
data.text: I have stayed at the Nugget several times through the years, actually saw it grow and expand. The man, John Ascuaga, was a genius in the way he promoted. Even in the early days, the rooms were OK. Today you will usually get a modern room with many amenities. I am usually part of a convention or trade show, thus getting lower rates. The service people have always been helpful and courteous. The bigger newer facility has good restaurants, fun gaming and much in the way of entertainment.  My latest visit was as part of a ukulele gathering. Happy uke strummers were everywhere and there was top-talent uke entertainment in the auditorium. They offer much space for conferences.  It’s a good place to stay unless you desire to be downtown.

data.title: birthday getaway
data.text: The Trip was very relaxing and enjoyable. I got a lot of much needed rest. I'm planning to return soon.

data.title: Great food and fun gaming!
data.text: Visiting here for the first time in several years we were pleasantly surprised by the high quality of this hotel.   We had a Deluxe King on the 15th floor of the West Tower, and even though the trains ran all night , we slept well in a very clean and comfortable room.   Thanks to being a "genius" level rater with booking.com we were able to get a very good room for a very good price in a last minute super deal..We also enjoyed the specials at the Oyster Bar and the very tasty Louie salads..   We will go there again when we can get to Nevada.. The gaming was fun too...

data.title: Reasonable and nice
data.text: This hotel is consistently a nice place to stay when in Reno. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable, restaurants great, parking easy, and swimming pool luxurious. To bad they no longer have spa. Checkin and out was painless. Best of all, the price is wonderful.

data.title: Welcom to the 70's
data.text: First stay here.  One tower apparently has been renovated--unfortunately we weren't in that one.  Our room was very old, dark, & dated--flowered wallpaper, old carpet, etc.  Old furniture.  Fairly comfortable bed.  Very little insulation between rooms, so noisey.  Also, one would think when going to a gambling destination, inroom safe would be available--not here.  Had to get a safe deposit box at the casino cashier.  Not very convenient.  Casino was OK, but also dark and dingey.  Good restaurants.  Friendly staff.  Because it is located in Sparks, it is a $20 cab ride to downtown Reno.

data.title: Great stay
data.text: Great experience, you can't beat the oyster bar it's phenomenal the only downside about my stay was there was a Mexican convention going on and getting on the elevator to get to the hotel room was nearly impossible, hundreds of people lined up to get on the elevator it took forever but still a good place to stay

data.title: girls night out
data.text: The nugget is awesome for the girls night out you are within walking distance to many little bars and the casino offers many different choses for food

data.title: Horrible
data.text: The hotel rooms to a serious update.  The rooms are dark, the furniture, carpet, and drapes are old and outdated.  The beds were very uncomfortable and should be replaced.  Oh, and parking is a joke. This was once my favorite hotel to stay in while visiting Reno/Sparks but I not be staying there anymore.  Very disappointed.

data.title: Dinning.
data.text: Love the clam chowder and the buffet! Every thing you would like is available. Sea food,prime rib and salads.

data.title: Friends and gambling
data.text:
Awesome time with friends and an excellent dinner at the Oyster Bar!
Service was excellent in both places and the food at the Oyster Bar is to die for!! You will not go wrong eating at the Oyster Bar! Try their Crab Louie! There has to be a whole crab in that salad!!😀

data.title: STAY AND PLAY
data.text: The Nugget has been our favorite go to "staycation" destination for years! The rooms are a great value, clean, modern and comfortable. There is an indoor pool that the kids LOVE. Restaurants and an arcade wrap up a practically perfect family get away. Try to stay during the week or off peak to avoid the crowds!

data.title: good times
data.text: Great place to stay. Clean rooms and a great environment! Shows, casino, restaurants, and bull riding!

data.title: Came for the rib cookoff
data.text: This place is just ok for what we paid. The room was large with a big view but dated. Coffee maker made a mess and there were no coffee cups. Plugs were few and loose making it inconvenient to charge phones. Heavy smoke smell, ubiquitous in the area, is unpleasant.

data.title: Leisure weekend
data.text: Hotel is great, casino is fun. Decent prices fir everything,  overall good value.  Pool atrium is beautiful but needs some sprucing up. It looks old and dirty.  A coat of paint would help a lot.

data.title: Good times at the Nugget
data.text: We came up to Reno to visit family and got a good deal at the Nugget. When we checked in they upgraded the room to the East Tower which were nicer rooms. The room was very nice and the TV in the bathroom was kinda cool. The views depending on what side of the hotel you are on. You have the railroad yard on one side and a view of Reno on the other. The restaurants were good and we enjoyed the casino. We would come back again.

data.title: Large
data.text: Massive building, confusing, but fun.  Old in need of updating, but clean.  Food reasonable and lots of restaurants to close from.mpool indoor which is weird and gym is on the better side  of what I have seen here in Nevada.
